docs.title: Basic Security Audit Tool
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for the Basic Security Audit Tool, a comprehensive security assessment framework implementing controls and guidelines from ISO 27002:2022 and NIST Special Publications.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Basic Security Audit Tool provides automated security assessments for:

  • DNS Security: Implementation of controls from ISO 27002:2022 Section 8.4 (Network Security) and NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5.
  • SSL/TLS Security: Compliance checks based on NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2 and industry best practices.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🔒 Standards Compliance: Built on ISO 27002:2022 and NIST guidelines
  • 🔍 Comprehensive Checks: In-depth security assessments for DNS and SSL/TLS
  • 📊 Detailed Reporting: Clear findings with severity levels and remediation steps
  • 🔄 Automated Workflow: Continuous security assessment integration
  • 📚 Rich Documentation: Detailed implementation guides and references

docs.title: ISO 27002:2022
docs.text:
The tool implements controls from ISO 27002:2022, focusing on:

  • Network Security Management (Section 8.4)
  • Cryptography (Section 8.24)
  • Information Security Assurance (Section 5.7)

docs.title: NIST Guidelines
docs.text:
Implementation follows these NIST Special Publications:

  • NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (Security Controls)
  • NIST SP 800-81-2 (Secure DNS Deployment)
  • NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2 (TLS Guidelines)

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
pip install security-audit-tool
security-audit example.com

For detailed installation instructions, see our Installation Guide.

docs.title: DNS Security Module
docs.text: The DNS Security module provides comprehensive security assessments for DNS infrastructure, implementing controls from ISO 27002:2022 and NIST Special Publications.

docs.title: Nameserver Redundancy
docs.text:
• Standard: ISO 27002:2022 (8.4)
  • Check: Verifies multiple nameservers in different networks
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_dns_redundancy()

docs.title: Zone Transfer Security
docs.text:
• Standard: ISO 27002:2022 (8.4)
  • Check: Tests for unauthorized zone transfers
  • Severity: Critical
  • Implementation: check_zone_transfer()

docs.title: DNSSEC Validation
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (SC-20)
  • Check: Verifies DNSSEC implementation and chain of trust
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_dnssec()

docs.title: DS Records
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-81-2
  • Check: Validates DS records in parent zone
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_dnssec()

docs.title: Response Rate Limiting
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-81-2
  • Check: Tests for DNS amplification protection
  • Severity: Medium
  • Implementation: check_response_rate_limiting()

docs.title: Cache Poisoning Protection
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-81-2
  • Check: Verifies source port randomization
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_cache_poisoning_protection()

docs.title: Implementation Details
docs.text:
from audit_tool.modules.dns_security import DNSSecurityAuditor

auditor = DNSSecurityAuditor("example.com")
findings = auditor.run_all_checks()

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Nameserver Redundancy
  2. Deploy nameservers in different networks

  3. Use multiple providers for resilience

  4. DNSSEC Implementation

  5. Enable DNSSEC signing
  6. Regularly rotate keys

  7. Monitor signature expiration

  8. Zone Transfer Security

  9. Restrict zone transfers to authorized IPs

  10. Use TSIG for transfer authentication

  11. Cache Poisoning Prevention

  12. Enable source port randomization
  13. Implement response rate limiting
  14. Use DNS cookies

docs.title: SSL/TLS Security Module
docs.text: The SSL/TLS Security module provides comprehensive security assessments for SSL/TLS implementations, following NIST guidelines and industry best practices.

docs.title: TLS Version Check
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2
  • Check: Verifies supported TLS versions
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_ssl_version()
  • Requirements: TLS 1.2 or higher

docs.title: Cipher Suite Security
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2
  • Check: Tests supported cipher suites
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_cipher_suites()
  • Requirements: Strong ciphers only (AES, ChaCha20)

docs.title: Certificate Validation
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-57 Part 1
  • Check: Validates certificate properties
  • Severity: Critical
  • Implementation: check_certificate()
  • Checks:
  • Expiration
  • Key Length
  • Signature Algorithm
  • Chain of Trust

docs.title: Key Usage
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-57 Part 1
  • Check: Verifies key usage extensions
  • Severity: Medium
  • Implementation: check_key_usage()

docs.title: Perfect Forward Secrecy
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2
  • Check: Verifies PFS support
  • Severity: Medium
  • Implementation: check_forward_secrecy()

docs.title: HSTS Implementation
docs.text:
• Standard: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2
  • Check: Tests HSTS configuration
  • Severity: High
  • Implementation: check_hsts()

docs.title: Implementation Details
docs.text:
from audit_tool.modules.ssl_security import SSLAuditor

auditor = SSLAuditor("example.com")
findings = auditor.audit()

docs.title: Security Controls Matrix
docs.text: Control Standard Implementation Test Coverage TLS Version NIST SP 800-52 check_ssl_version() ✅ Cipher Suites NIST SP 800-52 check_cipher_suites() ✅ Certificate NIST SP 800-57 check_certificate() ✅ Forward Secrecy NIST SP 800-52 check_forward_secrecy() ✅

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Protocol Configuration
  2. Disable SSL 2.0, 3.0, and TLS 1.0, 1.1
  3. Enable TLS 1.2 and 1.3

  4. Configure secure cipher order

  5. Certificate Management

  6. Use RSA 2048+ or ECC P-256+
  7. Implement automated rotation

  8. Monitor expiration dates

  9. Security Headers

  10. Enable HSTS with appropriate max-age
  11. Include subdomains directive

  12. Submit to HSTS preload list

  13. Forward Secrecy

  14. Prioritize ECDHE and DHE ciphers
  15. Use appropriate DH parameters
  16. Rotate keys regularly

docs.title: Weak Protocol Support
docs.text:
Finding: TLS 1.0/1.1 Enabled
Severity: High
Remediation: Disable TLS 1.0 and 1.1 in server configuration
Reference: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2 Section 3.1

docs.title: Insecure Cipher Suites
docs.text:
Finding: Weak Cipher Suites Detected
Severity: High
Remediation: Remove support for weak ciphers (RC4, DES, 3DES)
Reference: NIST SP 800-52 Rev. 2 Section 3.3
